lead_paragraph: A grand jury cleared Planned Parenthood of allegations of misconduct, instead indicting its opponents on charges including tampering with a governmental record.

byline.contributor: Erik Eckholm contributed reporting from New York.

snippet: A grand jury cleared Planned Parenthood of allegations of misconduct, instead indicting its opponents on charges including tampering with a governmental record.

headline.main: 2 Abortion Foes Behind Planned Parenthood Videos Are Indicted
headline.print_headline: Texas Charges Abortion Foes in Video Case

abstract: Houston grand jury probing accusations of misconduct against Planned Parenthood indicts abortion opponents David R Daleiden and Sandra S Merritt, whose organization Center for Medical Progress made undercover videos of organization; videos purportedly show Planned Parenthood officials attempting to illegally profit from sale of fetal tissue; charges include tampering with government records, a felony.
